pull.title: net, net_processing: additional and consistent disconnect logging
pull.body:
While debugging unexpected disconnections, possibly related to #28331, I found some additional [net] logging to be useful.

All cases where we disconnect now come with a log message that has the word `disconnecting`:

* `CloseSocketDisconnect()` logs `disconnecting peer=â€¦`
* whereever we set `pnode->fDisconnect = true;`
* for all `InactivityCheck` cases (which in turn sets `fDisconnect`)
* replaces "dropping" with "disconnecting" in `Network not active, dropping peer=â€¦`

I changed `CloseSocketDisconnect()` to no longer log `disconnecting`, and instead have all the call sites do so.

This PR introduces two helper functions on `CNode`: `DisconnectMsg` and `LogIP`. The second and third commit use these helpers in `net_processing.cpp` so these disconnect messages are more consistent now (e.g. some didn't log the IP). No new messages are added there though.

The `LogIP()` helper is rarely used outside of a disconnect event, but it's available for future use.

Any `LogPrint` this PR touches is replaced with `LogDebug` (superseded by #30750), and every `LogPrintf ` with `LogInfo`.

| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |

| Concept ACK | [ajtowns](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#issuecomment-1732548137), [jonatack](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#issuecomment-1834503005), [sr-gi](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#issuecomment-1879253826) |
| Stale ACK | [0xB10C](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#issuecomment-1733660917), [RandyMcMillan](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#issuecomment-1738202523), [naumenkogs](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#issuecomment-2342970431) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#29641](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29641) (scripted-diff: Use LogInfo over LogPrintf [WIP, NOMERGE, DRAFT] by maflcko)
* [#29415](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29415) (Broadcast own transactions only via short-lived Tor or I2P connections by vasild)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Concept ACK -- always makes sense to debug log disconnection reasons IMO
Code review ACK 320978662db6b17e61afbf77a6584e33181c12b9
Rebased.

Concept ACK. I'd find it helpful to also log the addrport if `fLogIPs` is true, along with the network (for instance, because IPv6 addresses look the same as CJDNS ones), e.g. something like `net=..., peeraddr=...,`

I added `peeraddr=` to each of them. This is indeed quite useful, because we can't look up the IP after disconnection. Adding `net=` also makes sense, but let's do that everywhere in another PR (probably using a helper function).

> because we can't look up the IP after disconnection.

Is the IP not logged on connection, when IP logging is enabled?

@maflcko indeed it is, though for inbound it depends on the exact log settings. I think right now you won't see these disconnect messages without `-debug=net` and with it you'll see all the connect messages. But if we increase the relative priority of disconnect messages then you might not. So it still seems useful to add.
Concept ACK. Just a single consideration: wouldn't it also make sense to test this with `-logips=1`?
@sr-gi I could, but I prefer to punt that until we have a helper function that can be tested in just one place: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#issuecomment-1835692974
Rebased after #30420.

Re-reviewed and manually tested ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/45958d595b70222c89c25768f357a2ebbafac2b1

It should be easy to grep for the reason that a peer got disconnected, and logging the peer's address when `fLogIPs` seems helpful.

Tested by running:

```bash
./bitcoind -datadir=/tmp/trash -debug=net -logips
```

made `fNetworkActive == false` by:

```bash
./bitcoin-cli -datadir=/tmp/trash setnetworkactive false
```

<details>

<summary>Got the following output:</summary>

```
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z SetNetworkActive: false
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=0 peeraddr=[REDACTEDIP]:8333
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=1 peeraddr=[REDACTEDIP]:8333
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=2 peeraddr=[REDACTEDIP]:8333
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=4 peeraddr=[REDACTEDIP]:8333
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=5 peeraddr=[REDACTEDIP]:8333
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=6 peeraddr=[REDACTEDIP]:8333
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] disconnecting peer=0
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] disconnecting peer=1
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] disconnecting peer=2
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] disconnecting peer=4
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] disconnecting peer=5
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] disconnecting peer=6
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] disconnecting peer=8
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] disconnecting peer=10
2024-07-23T01:08:08Z [net] disconnecting peer=11
```

</details>

Micro-nit: if the purpose is to reduce the need to do `grep -n2` , then it seems to me we should add the word 'disconnect' to *all* [instances](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/8754d055c65e11fd2afa59f9e5de7c60a9e0ec23/src/net.cpp#L1634) [where](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/45958d595b70222c89c25768f357a2ebbafac2b1/src/net.cpp#L2144) the reason appears in the line above, and *if* we were to always log the reason for disconnect when it happens,  it seems to me the extra generic log in `CloseSocketDisconnect` should be dropped.

Thanks @davidgumberg. I added a helper function `CNode::DisconnectMsg`, and it's now also used for:
* "receiving message bytes failed"
* "socket send error for"
* "socket recv error"
* "socket closed"

In order to get rid of the redundant generic "disconnecting peer" in `CNode::CloseSocketDisconnect()`, I added the log statement to the two remaining call sites.

Since it's a method on `CNode` I can use it in net_processing as well, for which I added a separate commit. It has the effect of slightly modifying some of the existing log messages, and adds IP address logging in a few more places.

I did not apply this to:
* "connected to self"
* some messages that would require a more complicated helper:
  * "disconnecting but not discouraging" 
  * "disconnecting extra block-relay-only peer=%d"
  * "disconnecting extra outbound peer"
  
While I was on a roll, I also added a `LogIP()` helper (as suggested earlier). There's only a small number of places where we print the IP address that's not in the context of a disconnect - but now it's easier to expand that. I skipped the "send version message" message log here.

rename.to: net, net_processing: additional and consistent disconnect logging

Make sure to run all tests locally, according to the documentation.

The failure may happen due to a number of reasons, for example:

* Possibly due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the
  affected test.

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

</details>
Pushed an update to consistently replace any `LogPrint` we touch with `LogDebug`, and every `LogPrintf ` with `LogInfo`. Also fixed some missing `\n` characters as found by tidy.
Rebased after #30750. It made the diff slightly smaller, since I had made the same changes on every line touched here.

ACK 08cd29f5020995294a4f6274e72afab58bf69aa2

The first two commits make logging cleaner and more uniform.
I'm not sure the last commit is useful, but it doesn't hurt either.

events.body: Rebased and dropped duplicate message in `CConnman::DisconnectNodes`.

reACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/9967e8feb62a0c30612e437b70d1d64a2e67b9e0

Thanks for putting up with the review churn on this, it looks great! This PR makes peer disconnect message logging more consistent, and makes us better respect the `-logips` argument.

I reviewed the range-diff:

```bash
git range-diff a74bdeea..08cd29f5 6fc46927..9967e8fe
```

<details>

<summary>Manual testing</summary>

Starting a node and then doing `bitcoin-cli setnetworkactive false` and got the following:

```console
2024-09-20T17:47:15Z SetNetworkActive: false
2024-09-20T17:47:15Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=0
2024-09-20T17:47:15Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=2
2024-09-20T17:47:15Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=4
2024-09-20T17:47:15Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=5
2024-09-20T17:47:15Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=6
2024-09-20T17:47:15Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=8
2024-09-20T17:47:15Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=9
```

Here is the disconnect logging that happens when a socket closes:

```console
2024-09-20T17:58:09Z [net] Added connection peer=1
2024-09-20T17:58:09Z [net] start sending v2 handshake to peer=1
2024-09-20T17:58:09Z [net] sending version (103 bytes) peer=1
2024-09-20T17:58:09Z [net] send version message: version 70016, blocks=0, txrelay=1, peer=1
2024-09-20T17:58:09Z [net] socket closed, disconnecting peer=1
2024-09-20T17:58:09Z [net] retrying with v1 transport protocol for peer=1
2024-09-20T17:58:09Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=1
2024-09-20T17:58:09Z [net] trying v1 connection xx.xx.xx.xx:8333 lastseen=27.2hrs
```

invalid transaction in an INV:

```console
2024-09-20T18:01:10Z [net] received: pong (8 bytes) peer=14
2024-09-20T18:01:10Z [net] received: inv (253 bytes) peer=14
2024-09-20T18:01:10Z [net] transaction (d9db66309820a33f00b0cc8c843cd8683fdc03357dbe1959a9de18afc04ff675) i
nv sent in violation of protocol, disconnecting peer=14
2024-09-20T18:01:10Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=14
```

service flags:

```console
2024-09-20T18:01:17Z [net] Added connection peer=15
2024-09-20T18:01:17Z [net] sending version (103 bytes) peer=15
2024-09-20T18:01:17Z [net] send version message: version 70016, blocks=0, txrelay=0, peer=15
2024-09-20T18:01:17Z [net] received: version (102 bytes) peer=15
2024-09-20T18:01:17Z [net] peer does not offer the expected services (0000040c offered, 00000009 expected),
 disconnecting peer=15
2024-09-20T18:01:17Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=15
```

shutdown:

```console
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] disconnecting peer=0
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=0
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] disconnecting peer=3
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=3
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] disconnecting peer=4
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=4
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] disconnecting peer=5
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=5
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] disconnecting peer=7
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=7
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] disconnecting peer=8
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=8
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] disconnecting peer=9
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=9
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] disconnecting peer=10
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=10
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] disconnecting peer=13
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=13
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] disconnecting peer=17
2024-09-20T18:03:00Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=17
```

</details>

comments.body:
`InactivityCheck()` already logs a reason for any case where it returns true, eg:

```
2023-09-26T07:21:14.013289Z [net] socket receive timeout: 1201s peer=745   <==== this one
2023-09-26T07:21:14.014945Z [net] disconnecting peer=745
2023-09-26T07:21:14.016616Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=745

2023-09-26T08:33:15.016157Z [net] version handshake timeout peer=9862    <=== and this one
2023-09-26T08:33:15.016539Z [net] disconnecting peer=9862
2023-09-26T08:33:15.017321Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=9862
```

Does an extra log entry here actually help? Would adding the word "disconnecting" to the log entries in `InactivityCheck()` be better?
Done, and also made sure the keyword `disconnecting` appears in all cases where we disconnect.
No, because `CloseSocketDisconnect` already uses that term. I updated the PR description (yesterday) to explain the reasoning here.
I think we should avoid accessing the global variable `fLogIPs`. A future refactor could add `m_log_ips` to `PeerManagerImpl` and/or `CConnman`, initialize it from `gArgs` and then drop `fLogIPs`.

nit:
```suggestion
            LogInfo("Peer is stalling block download, %s\n", pto->DisconnectMsg(fLogIPs));
```

I believe your PR makes sure that `DisconnectMsg` gets printed any time `fDisconnect == true` so this line results in a duplicate log in each of those instances.

For example when doing `bitcoin-cli setnetworkactive false`:

```console
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z SetNetworkActive: false
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=0 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=1 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=3 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=4 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=5 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=6 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=7 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] disconnecting peer=0 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] disconnecting peer=1 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] disconnecting peer=3 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] disconnecting peer=4 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] disconnecting peer=5 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] disconnecting peer=6 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
2024-09-18T00:32:49Z [net] disconnecting peer=7 peeraddr=xx.xx.xx.xx:8333
```
You're right. I dropped this line and checked again that anytime `fDisconnect` is set to `true` emits a log message.
